CS3250

Class UserAuthenticator

  • java.lang.Object
    • CS3250.UserAuthenticator

  • public class UserAuthenticator
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to create users, encrypt passwords/usernames, generate salts for password encryption, and to authenticate users on login

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserAuthenticator() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean authenticate(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, DataMan<User> data)
      Checks username and password against those stored in the database to see if the login is valid or not
      static User createUser(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Creates a new user but doesn't add it to the database
      static void createUser(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, DataMan<User> data)
      Creates a new user and adds it to the database
      static byte[] generateSalt()
      Generates a randomized byte array of length 8
      static byte[] getEncryptedPassword(java.lang.String password, byte[] salt)
      Hashes a plaintext password with PBKDF2 and a randomized salt into a byte array
      static byte[] getEncryptedUsername(java.lang.String username)
      Hashes a plaintext username into a byte array using PBKDF2

                              DataMan<User> data)

                              java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Creates a new user and adds it to the database

        username - - Plaintext username
        password - - Plaintext password
        data - - UserData object used to connect to database and add user

      • createUser

        public static User createUser(java.lang.String username,
                              java.lang.String password)
                       throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                              java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Creates a new user but doesn't add it to the database
        Parameters:
        username - - Plaintext username
        password - - Plaintext password
        Returns:
        User - User object containing username, password, and randomized salt
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - - Throws if the algorithm to be used for hashing does not exist
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - - Throws if the key specification fed to the secret key factory is invalid

      • authenticate

        public static boolean authenticate(java.lang.String username,
                                   java.lang.String password,
                                   DataMan<User> data)
                            throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                   java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Checks username and password against those stored in the database to see if the login is valid or not
        Parameters:
        username - - Plaintext username
        password - - Plaintext password
        data - - UserData object passed in from the GUI
        Returns:
        boolean - True if there exists a user with the same username and password, false if not
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - - Throws if the algorithm to be used for hashing does not exist
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - - Throws if the key specification fed to the secret key factory is invalid

      • getEncryptedUsername

        public static byte[] getEncryptedUsername(java.lang.String username)
                                   throws java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                                          java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Hashes a plaintext username into a byte array using PBKDF2
        Parameters:
        username - - Plaintext username
        Returns:
        byte[] - Hashed username
        Throws:
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - - Throws if the key specification fed to the secret key factory is invalid
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - - Throws if the algorithm to be used for hashing does not exist

      • getEncryptedPassword

        public static byte[] getEncryptedPassword(java.lang.String password,
                                          byte[] salt)
                                   throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                          java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Hashes a plaintext password with PBKDF2 and a randomized salt into a byte array
        Parameters:
        password - - Plaintext password
        salt - - Randomized byte array
        Returns:
        byte[] - Hashed password
        Throws:
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - - Throws if the key specification fed to the secret key factory is invalid
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - - Throws if the algorithm to be used for hashing does not exist
